paper_abstract: A dominating set of a graph G = (V,E) is a subset V' is an element of V of the nodes such that for all nodes v is an element of V, either v is an element of V' or a neighbor u of v is in V'. Several routing protocols in ad hoc networks use a dominating set of the nodes for routing. None of the existing algorithms has a constant approximation factor in a constant number of rounds in 3D. In this paper, we use the nodes' geometric locations to propose the first local, constant time algorithm that constructs a Dominating Set and Connected Dominating Set of a Unit Disk Graph (UDG) in a 3D environment. Theoretical lower bounds on the size of these sets are given.
paper_title: 3D Local Algorithm for Dominating Sets of Unit Disk Graphs
